We are looking for a Content Editor in Malaysia to join our Regulatory Publications Team. This is an amazing opportunity to work on Cortellis for Regulatory Intelligence. We have a great skill set in regulatory intelligence information and we would love to speak with you if you have skills in regulatory affairs.
Good eye for detail. Ability to delve deep into content and results
Capability to work remotely with peers in an international environment
It would be great if you also had . . .
At least 3-year experience in pharmaceutical sector and/or regulatory affairs departments
A good understanding of the EU regulatory and legal framework for medicines evaluation in the EU
Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in a highly matrixed organization
Analysis of large volumes of structured or unstructured data
What will you be doing in this role?
The main role of the Content Editor involves monitoring and collecting regulatory information from identified sources in line with CRI Scope and editorial processes
column3: publishing the regulatory documents. He/she gathers and analyses a variety of scientific
column4: regulatory and industry data to provide a comprehensive resource for the Pharmaceutical and devices industry. He/she also provides customer support and expertise; communicates new regulatory content to sales or product specialists; develop new content and enhance existing information to align with user’s needs and expectations.

column1: Research news releases and other information sources (Monitoring of Regulatory information on the Agency and/or Governmental website)
Analyze the changes in the regulatory requirements and implement them in the databases.
Editing all copies to a high standard for publication
Update the Cortellis RI database for a set of countries
Communicate relevant information to concerned stakeholders

The team consists of 12 editors (based in India) and is reporting to the Regulatory Publications team manager (based in France). The larger team has employees based in several different locations (EMEA and APAC). Regulatory Intelligence information is part of the Clarivate LS Content Operations Group and comprises several teams responsible for the daily collection
column2: synthesis and maintenance of data relating to regulatory information. These records form a core element of our Cortellis RI database.

The GPS team is also part of the E1 Support Centre working closely with Engineering

and resolved within SLA. This includes leading swarming with regional teams and global experts to resolve complex issues. including trying to reproduce the issue if required. This will typically be tickets related to base software/product and use case solution issues;

escalating any defects to GSG Engineering (Development) teams for defects under Experian One

  • Ensure best practice for end-to-end support of tickets for activated and live clients including the efficient application of the swarming model and maintenance of the support runbook as a single point of reference across all regions and global. This includes recommend process and service improvements
  • Ownership and management of knowledge base relating to incidents/issues based on the Knowledge centered service (KCS) principles

  • Managing backlog of tickets

who logged the issue to elicit further information

regions or other resolver groups

  • Handling a range of technical cases at any one time at all different complexities
  • Documenting solutions and producing knowledge articles on resolution steps and procedures
